intro: Euphorbia grandialata, commonly known as the coral tree, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It features striking, bright red bracts that resemble coral, giving it its common name. The plant has a thick, woody stem with dense clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil, making it suitable for arid environments. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
